bug.short_desc: owncloud client starts but settings window unable to show: QXcbConnection: XCB error: 3 (BadWindow)
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
The owncloud client starts without issue, and performs its normal duties, but when you request the window via the tray icon, or from the tray menu, the following is presented in the owncloud.log:
06-30 16:05:10:699 4263 unknown: QXcbConnection: XCB error: 3 (BadWindow), sequence: 482, resource id: 37748740, major code: 20 (GetProperty), minor code: 0 06-30 16:05:10:699 4263 unknown: QXcbConnection: XCB error: 3 (BadWindow), sequence: 483, resource id: 37748740, major code: 18 (ChangeProperty), minor code: 0 06-30 16:05:10:699 4263 unknown: QXcbConnection: XCB error: 3 (BadWindow), sequence: 484, resource id: 37748740, major code: 18 (ChangeProperty), minor code: 0 06-30 16:05:10:699 4263 unknown: QXcbConnection: XCB error: 3 (BadWindow), sequence: 485, resource id: 37748740, major code: 8 (MapWindow), minor code: 0 06-30 16:05:10:699 4263 unknown: QXcbConnection: XCB error: 3 (BadWindow), sequence: 487, resource id: 37748740, major code: 12 (ConfigureWindow), minor code: 0
And the window does not display. I am thus unable to login or sync. (seeing as how I tried to logout as a fix)
This is a similar, if not the, issue on github: https://github.com/owncloud/client/issues/4912
It seems that a new build might fix the problem.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
owncloud-client-2.2.0-8.fc24.x86_64
How reproducible:
Not sure where it's reproducible, it doesn't appear to be happening on my nvidia hardware, maybe just intel?

http://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/taskinfo?taskID=14720342
This scratch-build of mine for 2.2.2 works to fix this issue.
I am building v2.2.2 at the moment. This will be pushed to updates-testing once arm finishes building.
